trait.name: Breath Weapon
trait.text: You can use your action to exhale destructive energy, according to your dragon type. When you use your breath weapon, each creature in the area of the exhalation must make a saving throw. The DC for this saving throw equals 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus. A creature takes 3d6 damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. The damage increases to 4d6 at 6th level, 5d6 at 11th level, and 6d6 at 16th level. After you use your breath weapon, you can’t use it again until you complete a short or long rest. Refer to the Dragon Type chart for more information.

trait.name: Deadly Weapons
trait.text: You gain a +1 bonus to your claw and bite attacks. When you reach 7th level, this bonus becomes +2. At 15th level, you deal an extra 1d8 piercing damage with your bite attacks and an extra 1d6 slashing damage with your claw attacks.

trait.name: Dragon Resistance
trait.text: You have resistance to the damage type associated with your breath weapon. At 10th level, you gain immunity, instead of resistance.

trait.name: Enraged Fighter
trait.text: The blood coursing through your veins is set aflame at the smallest slight. When you take one full hit die's damage or more from a single attack, you must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a success, nothing happens. On a failure, you enter a rage-like state. While in this state, you must spend your turn in combat attacking the nearest creature, friend or foe, with full force, gaining a bonus to your attack and damage rolls equal to your level divided by 5 (rounded up). At the end of each round spent in this state, you may choose to make another Wisdom saving throw, with a DC equal to 15 + the number of rounds spent in the state, to exit it. You continue attacking until you are successful on this saving throw, there is no longer a valid target, or you are reduced to 0 hp or fewer, whichever comes first.

trait.name: Frightful Presence
trait.text: Each creature of your choice that is within 120 feet of you and aware of it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, with a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + either your Strength or Charisma modifier (your choice), or become frightened of you for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to your Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours. Once you use this ability, it cannot be used again until you complete a long rest.

trait.name: Limited Flight
trait.text: As a bonus action, you may sprout wings and take flight. You may use this ability a number of times per day equal to your Constitution modifier. While aloft, you have a fly speed equal to twice your walking speed. You can stay aloft for a number of rounds equal to 1 + your Constitution modifier (minimum 1 round), after which time you begin falling at a rate of 30 feet per round, taking the appropriate fall damage when you land. When you land, if you survive, you must make a Dexterity saving throw, with a DC equal to 5 + the number of feet you fell divided by 5, falling prone on a failure.

trait.text: All ancient dragons have razor-sharp teeth and claws that they can utilize in combat. Your claws deal 1d6 slashing damage, while your bite deals 1d8 piercing damage. You are proficient with your bite and claw attacks, which are modified by your Strength modifier.

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light.

trait.name: Dwarven Resilience
trait.text: You are immune to poisons and you have resistance against poison damage.

trait.name: Dwarven Combat Training
trait.text: You have proficiency with the battleaxe, handaxe, throwing hammer, warhammer, and light and medium armor. In addition, you are proficient in any weapon or armor with "dwarven" in the name and treat them as a +1 masterwork item. If the item is already a masterwork item, you treat it as a +2 masterwork item, instead

trait.name: Practiced Hands
trait.text: You gain proficiency with the artisan’s tools of your choice: carpenter's tools, mason's tools, or smith’s tools. You gain double your proficiency bonus when using these tools. In addition, you gain the crafter feat.

trait.name: Dwarven Toughness
trait.text: Your hit point maximum increases by 2, and it increases by 2 every time you gain a level.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common and Dwarvish.

trait.name: Ancient
trait.text: Ancient dwarves must take the ancient background.

trait.name: Superior Darkvision
trait.text: Accustomed to twilit forests and the night sky, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light.

trait.name: Keen Senses
trait.text: You gain proficiency in the Perception skill and gain double your proficiency bonus in this skill.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can’t put you to sleep.

trait.name: Trance
trait.text: Elves don’t need to sleep. Instead, they meditate deeply, remaining semiconscious, for 4 hours a day. While meditating, you can dream after a fashion; such dreams are actually mental exercises that have become reflexive through years of practice. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit that a human does from 8 hours of sleep.

trait.name: Elven Weapon Training
trait.text: You have proficiency with the longsword, shortsword, shortbow, and longbow. In addition, you are proficient in any weapon or armor with "elven" in the name and treat them as a +1 masterwork item. If the item is already a masterwork item, you treat it as a +2 masterwork item, instead.

trait.name: One With the Weave
trait.text: You know one cantrip and one 1st level spell of your choice from the wizard spell list. As you gain levels, you learn spells of higher levels. When you reach 3rd level, you learn a 2nd level spell, a 3rd level spell at 5th level, a 4th level spell at 7th level, and a 5th level spell at 9th level. You can cast a spell of 1st level or higher that you learned with this feature once per day. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

trait.name: Mask of the Wild
trait.text: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common, Elvish, and one extra language of your choice.

trait.name: Ancient
trait.text: Ancient elves must take the ancient background.

trait.name: Earth Allergy
trait.text: Being of the Etheral Darkness, you must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take maximum damage versus all wood, stone, or glass weapons.

trait.name: Favored by Darkness
trait.text: Accustomed to Erebus' complete darkness, you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) and Dexterity (Stealth) checks and you can see as if you were in bright light while in nonmagical darkness.

trait.name: Frail of Body
trait.text: An ancient vampire has disadvantage on all Constitution saving throws, and their Constitution modifier is 0.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: Erebus blessed your body with the gift of natural healing. You regenerate a number of lost hit points each round equal to half your proficiency bonus.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: As a bonus action, you may cast the spider climb spell innately a number of times per day equal to your proficiency bonus. When you cast this spell, you may target only yourself and pay no costs for the spell.

trait.name: Undying
trait.text: At 10th level, your ability to survive against the odds becomes baffling, even for you. You gain the die hard feat, and do not need to meet the prerequisites for this feat.

trait.name: Vampire Age
trait.text: An ancient vampire does not need to sleep or breathe. They gain sustenance by partaking of another creature's blood and are immune to poison, disease, and sleep effects.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Abyssal and Common.

trait.name: Ancient
trait.text: Ancient vampires must take the ancient background.

trait.name: Superior Low-Light Vision
trait.text: You can see in dim light as well as you do in bright light.

trait.name: Shape Change
trait.text: You may use a bonus action to shape shift to or from your beast form. When undergoing the transformation, your armor and other things equipped but not wielded transform with you, you drop all items you are holding, and you experience excruciating pain, and can only make the transformation to and from a number of times per day equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum 1). Should you ever be dropped to 0 hit points, you immediately turn back into your normal form and fall unconscious.

trait.name: Improved Scent
trait.text: You have a heightened sense of smell and gain advantage on Wisdom (Nature), Wisdom (Perception), Intelligence (Search), and Wisdom (Survival) checks involving scent.

trait.name: Silver Allergy
trait.text: If struck by a silvered weapon, you must make a DC 10 Constitution save, taking maximum damage instead of normal on a failure.

trait.name: Alpha Defense
trait.text: Ancient Werewolves may expend hit dice to absorb damage from themselves or an ally within 5 feet. These hit dice are regained normally. When expending hit dice in this way, roll your hit die and add your Dexterity modiﬁer to the roll, reducing the damage dealt by this amount.

trait.name: Call the Pack
trait.text: An Ancient may howl a number of times per day equal to its proficiency bonus, calling 1d4 wolves to its side. These wolves will obey the Ancient Werewolf's commands and even die to protect it. You may only have a maximum of 4 wolves at any time.

trait.name: Werewolf Immunities
trait.text: If contracting a disease or curse, an Ancient werewolf may make a DC 15 Constitution check to resist the effects.

trait.name: Beast Form
trait.text: While in beast form, you gain the following properties.
Size. Your size becomes large, and you grow thick hair all over your body, taking the form of a giant wolf.

Quadruped. In your new form, you must walk on all 4 limbs, meaning that you lose the use of your hands and opposable thumbs. You cannot interact with objects that require the use of thumbs or hands and cannot wield weapons or shields. While using all four limbs for movement, your speed increase by 10 feet.
Unfocused. You cannot use spells or abilities that require concentration.

Natural Weapons. You gain a claw and bite attack. Your claw attack deals a number of d6 in damage equal to your proficiency bonus, while you bite deals a number of d8 in damage, following the same rule.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common and Wolf.

trait.name: Ancient
trait.text: Ancient werewolves must take the ancient background.

trait.name: Skill Proficiencies
trait.text: Choose two from Arcana, History, Nature, or Religion

trait.name: Tool Proficiencies
trait.text: Choose any one tool

trait.name: Equipment
trait.text: A tool or set of tools that you are proficient in, a thick, leather-bound journal, a bottle of ink, a quill, a set of fine clothes, and a belt pouch containing 20 gp.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Primordial.

trait.name: Feature: Ancient Lore
trait.text: As an ancient, your knowledge of past events is exceptionally vast. Whenever you make a skill check with either of the two skills you chose when you chose this background, you may add double your proficiency bonus.
